question.content: 'Gugga Naumi' the festival celebrated in Haryana and some parts of Punjab, Rajasthan, UP and Himachal Pradesh_ is known as the festival of:

solution.content: Snake-worshiping. Gugga Naumi festival celebrated in the honour of Gugga Pir. It is observed on the 9th day of the Krishna Paksha (waning phase of moon) in Bhadon month (August and September).

question.content: Doul Utsav is majorly celebrated in which of the following states?

solution.content: Assam. Doul Utsav is also called 'holi' or 'rang. Other festivals celebrated in Assam Bihu, Baishagu, Ali-Ai-Ligang, Baikho, Rongker, Rajini Gabra, Harni Gabra, Bohaggiyo Bishu, Ambubachi Mela and Jonbill Mela. Festivals in other states: Bihar Chhath Puja, Bihula, Sama chakeva. Chhattisgarh Pola, Madai Festival, Hareli, Bhoramdeo Mahotsav. Maharashtra - Ganesh Utsav, Gudi Padva.

question.content: Bhagoria is a festival associated with which of the following festivals?

solution.content: Holi: A Hindu festival that is celebrated in the spring season. Bhagoria is a tribal festival that is celebrated in Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra. Tribal Festivals Hornbill Festival (Nagaland), Tusu Parab (Jharkhand), Bastar Dussehra (Chhattisgarh), Nagoba Jatara (Telangana).

question.content: For how many days is the Tirupati Tirumala Brahmotsavam organised?

solution.content: 9. Tirupati Tirumala Brahmotsavam - It is annually celebrated at the Venkateswara Temple in Tirupati district in Andhra Pradesh. Other Temple Festivals: Thrissur Pooram (Vadakkumnathan Temple, Kerala), Arattu festival (Sree PadmanabhaSwamy Temple, Kerala), Vaikunth Chaturdashi Mela (Kamleshwar Mahadev Temple, Uttarakhand), Buddha Purnima (Mahabodhi Temple, Bodhgaya, Bihar), Ambubachii Mela (Kamakhya Devi Temple, Assam).

question.content: Chethiyagiri Vihara Festival is organised in which state?

solution.content: Madhya Pradesh. States and their festivals: Himachal Pradesh - Halda, Maghi, Doongri, Ladarcha, Chet, Kullu Dussehra. Tripura Kharchi, Ker and Garia. Telangana - Bathukamma, Bonalu, Medaram Jatara. West Bengal Durga Puja, Poila Baishakh.

question.content: In which month, as per the Hindu calendar, is the birth anniversary of Lord Mahavir Swami celebrated?

solution.content: Chaitra. Hindu calendar and their festival/jayanti: Chaitra - Ugadi, Gudi Padwa, Rama Navami, Hanuman Jayanti. Vaishakha - Parshuram jayanti, Akshaya Tritiya. Jyeshtha - Gayatri Jayanti, Ganga Dussehra. Ashadha Guru Purnima, Jagannath Rthyatra. Shravana Nag Panchami, Raksha Bandhan. Bhadrapada Krishna Janmashtami, Ganesh Chaturthi, Hartalika teej. Ashwin Durga Ashtami. Kartik - Karwa Chauth, Dhanteras, Diwali, Bhaiya Dooj, Chhath Puja.

question.content: What does Gudi signify in Gudi Padwa festival as per Hindu mythology?

solution.content: Symbol of victory. Gudi Padwa: It is marathi new year. Gudi is made by tying a piece of fresh cloth around a bamboo stick of about 5 feet long and Marathis place neem leaves along with sugar candy garland on it. The stick is then placed in a silver or bronze pot. In Karnataka, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh this festival is also known as Ugadi. It is celebrated in the first month of Chaitra.

question.content: Which of the following statements is/are correct regarding the Hornbill Festival? A. The Hornbill Festival is celebrated in the North-eastern state of Nagaland. B.The festival takes place in the month of January. C. The name of the festival is derived from the Indian Hornbill, a bird that is an essential character of the folk tales of the state.

solution.content: Both A and C. Hornbill Festival is celebrated from 1 to 10 December in Nagaland. It is also called festivals of festivals.

question.content: Which of the following statements is/are correct regarding Bathukamma Festival? A. This festival is celebrated in the state of Telangana. B. Bathukamma which means 'Mother Goddess come and live' is a colourful floral festival. C. This festival is celebrated for 9 days mostly during September or October (mostly before Dussehra). D. During this festival, men will sing songs and dance around the flower bunches.

solution.content: Only A, B and C.

question.content: What is the Malayalam New Year called in Kerala?

solution.content: Vishu is celebrated on the first day of the Malayalam month of Medam, which usually falls in the month of April.

question.content: Moatsu festival of Nagaland is celebrated by which of the following tribes?

solution.content: Ao tribe. Moatsu Festival: Celebrated in the first week of May every year for 3 days. During this festival one of the symbolic celebrations is Sangpangtu, where a big fire is lit and men and women sit around it putting on their complete best attire. Other Tribal festivals of Nagaland - Hornbill Festival (Naga tribe), Sekrenyi (Angami tribe), and Aoleang (Konyak Nagas).

question.content: Ker and Garia Puja are traditional tribal festivals of which state?

solution.content: Tripura. Other festivals (Tripura): kharchi Puja, Bizu Festival, Ashokastami, Lampra Puja, Wah festival etc. Manipur (Gang-Ngai, Lui-Ngai-Ni, Yaosang, Cheiraoba, Kang). Jharkhand (Karam, Sarhul, Rohini, Sohrai, Makar). Odisha (Ratha Yatra, Raja Parba, Naukhai, Kalinga Mahotsav).

question.content: Which Goddess is associated with the Gangaur Festival celebrated in Central and Western India?

solution.content: Goddess Parvati. Festivals and their related god/goddess: Goddess Saraswati Basant Panchami. Goddess Kali Shyama Puja or Mahanisha Puja. Goddess Laxmi Deepavali (Diwali). Gangaur Festival is majorly celebrated in Rajasthan.

question.content: In which of the following states is the Bonalu festival celebrated?

solution.content: Telangana. Bonalu is a Hindu Festival where Goddess Mahakali is worshiped. It is celebrated usually in Ashada Masam that falls in July/August. Special poojas are performed for goddess Yellamma during the first and last day of the festival.

question.content: Rongker festival is celebrated by which of the following tribes?

solution.content: Karbi (Dehal in Dumra Longri). Rongker is an annual winter time festival of merriment observed by the Karbis of Assam. Tribes and their festivals: Garo tribe (Meghalaya) Wangala Festival. Bhil tribe (Madhya Pradesh) - Bhagoria Festivals. Tharu tribe (Southern Nepal and Northern India) - Tihar (Deepawali), and Jitiya. Bhutia tribe (Sikkim) and Monpa tribe (Arunachal Pradesh) - Losar festival.

question.content: Which of the following cultural festivals of South India is associated with the folklore of King Mahabali?

solution.content: Onam It is a religious and Harvesting festival celebrated by Hindu of Kerala, on Chaturdashi Tithi of Shukla Paksha in the month of Shravana.

question.content: Chapchar Kut predominantly celebrated in festival

solution.content: Mizoram. Chapchar kut celebrated every year in the month of March after the completion of the jhum operation (Clearing of the remnants of burning). States and their festivals: Mizoram - Anthurium, Mim Kut, Pawl Kut. Nagaland - Hornbill, Sekrenyi, Aoleang. Meghalaya Shad Suk Mynsiem, Nongkrem, Behdienkhlam, Wangala. Manipur Gang-Ngai, Lui-Ngai-Ni, Yaosang.

question.content: Chad Shukra (Chad Sukra) festival is celebrated by the Jayanti tribe of

solution.content: Meghalaya. Chad Shukra is a sowing festival of Jaintia communities. Other festivals of Meghalaya Behdienkhlam (Jaintia), Wangala (Garo), Ka Shad Suk Mynsiem (Khasi), Nongkrem (Khasi).

question.content: Nauroz is celebrated by which of the following communities in India?

solution.content: Parsi. Nauroz: New year of Iranian and Persian. The festival symbolizes the coming of spring season. Communities and their festivals: Hindu- Diwali, Holi, Dussehra, Ganesh Chaturthi. Christian Easter, Christmas. Sikh Vaisakhi, Bandi Chhor Divas, Guru Nanak Gurpurab. Jain - Paryushan, Diwali.

question.content: According to Sikh literature, the birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev is celebrated on the full moon day of the Indian lunar month

solution.content: Kartik. The Sikhs have been celebrating Guru Nanak's Gurpurab around November. Guru Nanak: Born April 15, 1469, Rai Bhoi di Talvandi (now Nankana Sahib, Pakistan), near Lahore. Died 1539, Kartarpur, Punjab, the first Guru of Sikhism. He attained enlightenment in Sultanpur Lodhi (Punjab). He was also a Nirguna Bhakti saint.

question.content: The Nuakhai festival of is observed on Panchami Tithi (fifth day) of the lunar fortnight of Bhadrava (August-September), the day after Ganesh Chaturthi.

solution.content: Odisha. Nuakhai is a festival for the worship of food grain involving cutting of the first crop and reverent offering of the same to the mother goddess. Meaning of Nuankhai celebration is 'eating of new rice'.

question.content: is celebrated in Jharkhand immediately after Diwali on the new moon day in the honour of cattle.

solution.content: Sohrai - A chief festival of Santhal tribe. It is celebrated on Amavasya (new moon) in the Hindu month of Kartik (October-November). It is known for the care of domestic animals, such as cows and buffaloes. Other festivals of Jharkhand: Sarhul, Karam, Hal Punhya, Bhagat Parab, Rohini, Bandana and Java.

question.content: The sal tree assumes great significance in a number of tribal communities scattered across eastern India. For instance festival is celebrated in honour of the tree, in Jharkhand.

solution.content: Sarhul: Celebrated by Oraon, the Munda and the Ho tribes of Jharkhand. It marks the beginning of New Year. Celebrated - Every year in the first month of the Hindu calendar, on the third day of the moon or the fortnight of 'Chaitra'.

question.content: Buddha Purnima is marked on a full moon day in the Hindu month of

solution.content: Vaisakh (2nd month of the Hindu Calendar). Buddha Purnima (Buddha Jayanti) commemorates the birth, enlightenment (nirvana), and death (parinirvana) of Gautama Buddha (founder of Buddhism).

question.content: is one of the most important festivals of Kamakhya temple of Guwahati. It is held every year during the monsoon (mid-June) season, when the temple is closed for three days for tantric rites.

solution.content: Ambubachi. Festivals of Assam: Bihu, Baishagu, Ali-Ai-Ligang, Baikho, Rongker, Rajini Gabra Harni Gabra, Bohaggiyo Bishu, Me-Dum-Me-Phi (ancestor worship festival), Jonbill Mela.

question.content: One of the prominent festivals celebrated in is the 'Me-Dum-Me-Phi', i.e., the ancestor worship festival.

solution.content: Assam. Me-Dam-Me-Phi festival: It is celebrated all over Assam on January 31 every year. The festival states the offering of obligations to the dead and sacrifice to Gods. Other festivals of Assam: Bihu, Baishagu, Ali-e-Ligang, Baikho, Rongkar, Rajni Gabra Harni Gabra, Bohagio Bishu, Ambubashi Mela and Jonbil Mela. States and their festivals: Nagaland (Hornbill festival, Sekreni). Manipur (Gang-Ngai, Hikru Hidongba). Meghalaya (Wangala, Nongkrem dance).

question.content: Dree Utsav is celebrated in the state of

solution.content: Arunachal Pradesh. States and their Festivals: Arunachal Pradesh Boori Boot, Myoko, Pongtu, Murung, Solang, Mopin, Monpa. Kerala Snake Boat (Vallam Kali), Theyyam, Onam, Attukal Pongala. Andhra Pradesh: Pongal, Ugadi, Rottela Panduga, Prabhala Theertham, Visakha Utsav, Tirupati Tirumala Brahmotsavam, Lumbini Festival, Rayalaseema Food and Dance Festival, etc.

question.content: 'Losoong' festival, celebrated by the tribal community in , is usually the time when the farmers rejoice and celebrate their harvest.

solution.content: Sikkim. Losoong (Namsoong) is a Sikkimese New Year festival. The festival is celebrated by Bhutia and Lepcha tribes in India, Bhutan and Nepal. Famous Festivals in Sikkim: Drupka Teshi, Bumchu, Saga Dawa, Dassin, Phang Lhabsol, Maghe Sankranti, Sonam Lochar, Tendong Lho Rum Faat, Guru Rimpoche's Thunkar Tshechu, Indra Jatra, Barahimizong, Sakewa.

question.content: Which festival brings out the fusion rich culture of Chhattisgarh and Odisha?

solution.content: Bastar Goncha (referred to as chariot festival) Performed by the Bastar tribal people. It is observed during the Rath Yatra (June or July) of Odisha. Other tribal festivals of Chhattisgarh: Bastar Dussehra, Bastar Lokotsav, Koriya Mela, Fagun Wadai, Madai Festival and Pola Festival. Himachal Pradesh (Shoolini Fair Solan). Gujarat (Madhavpur Fair - Porbandar).

question.content: The Sakraat festival is celebrated with the 'Budigali' or 'Kalasi' dance in where women take part in this dance, carrying decorative pots on their heads.

solution.content: Odisha.

question.content: 'Atla Taddi', a festival celebrated by married and unmarried women alike to seek the blessings of Devi Gauri for a long and happy married life and a suitable groom, respectively, is celebrated in

solution.content: Andhra Pradesh. This festival is similar to Karwa Chauth which is mainly celebrated in north india. This festival is going to be observed on the Ashwayuja Thadia (third day) after the full moon.

question.content: The Konark Dance Festival (KDF) has been held at Konark since 1986 between every year.

solution.content: 1st and 5th December. The Konark Dance Festival is held at an open-air auditorium in the backdrop of the Sun Temple (Black Pagoda). Dance Festival in India - Bamnia Chhau Dance Festival (West Bengal), Khajuraho Dance Festival (Madhya Pradesh), Mamallapuram Dance Festival and Natyanjali Festival (Tamil Nadu), Nishagandhi Dance Festival (Kerala), Sirpur Music and Dance Festival (Chhattisgarh).

question.content: Bastar Dussehra is celebrated in which of the following states?

solution.content: Chattisgarh. Bastar Dussehra (75 days long) started in the 13th Century during the reign of the 4th King of Bastar, King Purshottam Dev. Deity - Goddess Danteshwari Devi.

question.content: Lui Ngai Ni is a festival that is associated with which of the following states?

solution.content: Manipur. Lui Ngai Ni - A festival that is celebrated by the Naga tribes of Manipur (India). It is a seed-sowing festival that marks the beginning of the new year for the Nagas. The festival is celebrated on February 15th every year.

question.content: Indian festival Dussehra is a famous celebration that takes place at which of the following?

solution.content: Mysore Palace (Karnataka). Established 1912, Started construction in 1897. It was the residence of Wodeyars rulers who ruled Mysore for seven centuries. Nizam Palace (Kolkata) - It was constructed in 1933.

question.content: Which of the following is a festival and dance?

solution.content: Bihu (Assam). Festivals of Assam: Majuli, Dehing Patkai, Kaziranga Elephant, Ali Ai Ligang, Rongker & Chomangkan, Raas Lila, Karam Puja, Baishagu.

question.content: Pawl Kut is a thanksgiving festival of which Indian state?

solution.content: Mizoram. Thanksgiving festivals Pawl kut (Straw harvest festival), Lyuva Khutla (Mara Tribes) in Mizoram, Uttarayan (Gujarat), Lohri (Punjab), Onam (Kerala), Bhogali Bihu (Assam), Pongal (Tamil Nadu), Gudi Padwa (Maharashtra), Ugadi (Andhra Pradesh, Telangana and Karnataka).

question.content: Of which of the following states is Jallikattu a famous bull-taming festival?

solution.content: Tamil Nadu. Jallikattu: Part of Pongal celebrations on Mattu Pongal day which occurs annually in January. Some Other Festivals: Natyanjali Dance Festival, Karthigai Deepam, Aadi Perukku.

question.content: The famous Rath Yatra, Car Festival is associated with which Lord?

solution.content: Lord Jagannath. Rath Yatra - It is Hindu chariot festival celebrated annually, on the bright half of the lunar month of Ashadh (June- July). Jagannath temple Built by King Anantavarman of the Chodaganga dynasty in the 12th century and recognised by European sailors as the white pagoda in the 19th century.

question.content: Kajari festival is celebrated in which of the following states?

solution.content: Chhattisgarh. Kajari Festival - Celebrated by farmers. Time - Beginning of sowing season for wheat and barley.

question.content: Which of the following festivals is celebrated on the Makar Sankranti day in Assam?

solution.content: Magh Bihu. Types of Bihu festival: Rongali or Bohag Bihu (April), Kongali or Kati Bihu (October), Bhogali or Magh Bihu (January). Name of Makar Sankranti in different states: Magha saaji Himachal Pradesh, Poush sankranti West bengal, Pongal Tamil Nadu, Uttarayan - Gujarat, Makaravilakku Kerala, Pedda Panduga Andhra pradesh.

question.content: Since 2004, which of the following states in India is the permanent venue of International Film Festival of India?

solution.content: Goa. International Film Festival of India, founded in 1952. The first IFFI was held in 1952 in Bombay, and it has been held in Goa since 2004.

question.content: Tulip Festival is famous in which city?

solution.content: Srinagar. Tulip Festival in Kashmir is celebrated annually to display the vast range of flowers at the Indira Gandhi Memorial Tulip Garden in Srinagar. It is organized during the onset of spring season in Kashmir valley. Other Flower Festivals in India: Rose Festival (Chandigarh), Ooty Flower Show (Tamil Nadu), International Flower Festival (Gangtok, Sikkim), Lalbagh Flower Show (Bangalore), Dasara Flower Show (Mysore), Cherry Blossom Festival (Shillong, Meghalaya).

question.content: Gaan-Ngai is a five-day festival primarily celebrated in which part of India?

solution.content: North-Eastern. The Gaan Ngai festival is celebrated after the harvest. Observed By The Zeliangrong people. States where it is mainly Celebrated - Assam, Manipur, Nagaland.

question.content: Deepavali is celebrated in which month of Hindu calendar?

solution.content: Kartika is the 8th month of the Hindu Calendar. Festivals Govardhana Puja, Bhaiya Dooj, Narak Chaturdashi, Dhanteras. Chaitra (March- April) - First month in Hindu calendar. Festivals - Ranga Panchami, Gudi Padwa, Rama Navami, Hanuman Jayanti. Ashwin (September October) 7th month in Hindu calendar. Festivals Saraswati puja, Durga Ashtami, Indira Ekadashi, Shardiya Navratri.

question.content: Chaitrual and Phulaich are the festival of which of the following states?

solution.content: Himachal Pradesh. Chaitrual (festival of pictures) celebrated in the month of Chaitra (March April) in Sirmaur area. Phulaich (festival of flowers)- celebrated on the 16th day of the Hindu month of Bhadrapada (August - September).

question.content: Rajini Gabra and Harni Gabra is the cultural festival of which of the following Indian states?

solution.content: Assam. Rajini Gabra and Harni Gabra is an annual festival of the Dimasa tribe. This socio-religious festival is celebrated before starting new cultivation.

question.content: Which of the following festivals is associated with the term 'ties of protection'?

solution.content: Raksha Bandhan (Hindu festival). According to hindu calendar, Raksha Bandhan is celebrated on the full-moon day of the Hindu month of Shravana. Other festivals celebrated on the full moon day Holi, Guru Nanak Jayanti, Karthik Purnima.

question.content: Nag Panchami is celebrated in which month of Hindu Calendar?

solution.content: Shravan. Other festivals in Shravan month Raksha Bandhan, Hariyali Teej, Narali Purnima. Kartik Month festival - Karwa Chauth, Rama Ekadashi, Dhanteras, Lakshmi Puja (Deewali), Bhaiya Dooj, Chhath Puja. Ashad- Jagannath Rathyatra, Guru Purnima, Yogini Ekadashi. Sharad Purnima is the harvest festival that is celebrated during the holy month of Ashwin in the Hindu lunar calendar.

question.content: Banganga festival takes place annually at which of the following places in Maharashtra?

solution.content: Mumbai. Banganga festival: A two-day music festival (tribute to Lord Rama) celebrated annually in the month of January in Malabar Hills, Mumbai.

question.content: This event is celebrated to mark the resurrection of Christ. Identify the event.

solution.content: Easter. Important Christian days and festivals: Christmas day - Birth of Jesus Christ. Good Friday - Jesus was crucified. Holy Thursday or Maundy Thursday - refers to the Thursday before Easter in the Christian calendar. It commemorates the Last Supper of Jesus Christ with his apostles. Epiphany (Twelfth Night) Christian feast day celebrated on January 6th, twelve days after Christmas, commemorating the visit of the Magi (Wise Men or Three Kings) to the infant Jesus in Bethlehem.

question.content: During which festival is Garba performed?

solution.content: Navratri. It is a nine day festival dedicated to the worship of Maa Durga and her nine avatars (Navdurga).

question.content: In which state is the Chithirai festival celebrated?

solution.content: Tamil Nadu. Chithirai Festival - celebrates the celestial union of Lord Sunderswarar (Lord Shiva) and Goddess Meenakshi, considered to be Lord Vishnu's sister. Celebrated in Madurai.

question.content: The activity of making a human pyramid and putting efforts to break an earthen pot filled with buttermilk is associated with which festival?

solution.content: Janmashtami. It is a Hindu festival celebrating the birth of god Krishna on the eighth (ashtami) day of the dark fortnight of the month of Bhadrapada. Dahi handi is a popular festival in Maharashtra. Famous festivals related to Lord Krishna: Govardhan Puja, Holi. Lord Krishna temples in India:- Jagannath Temple (Puri, Odisha), Dwarkadhish (Gujarat), Guruvayur (Kerala), Udupi Sri Krishna Matha (Karnataka).

question.content: In which city of Assam is the Tea Festival celebrated every year?

solution.content: Jorhat. The Tea Festival in the state of Assam is celebrated every year during the winter season between November and January. Major festivals celebrated (Assam): Bihu, Baishagu, Ali-Ai-Ligang, Baikho, Rongker, Rajini Gabra Harni Gabra, Bohaggiyo Bishu, Ambubashi Mela and Jonbill Mela.

question.content: Which of the following states organizes 'Lokrang', a five-day festival, beginning every year on 26 January?

solution.content: Madhya Pradesh. Lokrang- The festival is organized by Madhya Pradesh Adivasi Lok Kala Academy. Some other festivals: Madhya Pradesh: Khajuraho, Bhagoria Haat, Malwa Utsav, Karma, Larukaz, Gangaur.

question.content: Which festival traces its origin to the Tibetan New Year and in Ladakh, it is celebrated every year at the end of the harvesting season?

solution.content: Losar festival: It is celebrated in India in various parts such as Arunachal Pradesh, Ladakh, Sikkim, The Lahaul district of Himachal Pradesh. It marks the beginning of the Tibetan new year. It is usually celebrated by the tribes who believe in the Mahayana sect of Buddhism like the Sherdukpens, Khamba, Memba, Monpa tribe, etc.

question.content: The 'Kambala' festival is organised by farming communities in the state of

solution.content: Karnataka. The Kambala festival is essentially associated with the Buffalo race. The festival is dedicated to Hindu God Lord Kadri Manjunatha, who is the epitome of Lord Shiva.

question.content: The Sikhs celebrate Bandi Chhor Divas which coincides with which Hindu festival?

solution.content: Diwali. Bandi Chhor Divas - A Sikh celebration that commemorates the day on which, the sixth Guru of Sikhs, Guru Hargobind released 52 prisoners from Gwalior Fort, who had been imprisoned by Mughal Emperor Jahangir. Emperor Jahangir had held 52 Kings at Gwalior. Other Sikh Festivals - Muktsar Mela, Parkash Utsav Dasveh Patshah, Holla Mohalla, Gurpurab.

question.content: Which festival has the meaning 'to boil' or 'boiling' in its name?

solution.content: Pongal (harvest festival) considered to be one of the major festivals of South India and it is mainly celebrated in Tamil Nadu.

question.content: Doongri festival of Himachal Pradesh is primarily celebrated by which religious community?

solution.content: Hindu. Doongri Festival: It is celebrated in Kullu district (Himachal pradesh) in the month of may as the birthday of Hadimba devi (wife of Bhima).

question.content: Tamladu is a festival celebrated by the Buddhist community of which Indian state?

solution.content: Arunachal Pradesh. It celebrated in the Lohit district by the Digaru Mishmis tribe.

question.content: Guruvayur Ekadashi is the cultural festival of which Indian state?

solution.content: Kerala. Guruvayur Ekadashi is observed in the famous Sri Guruvayur Krishna temple. It is observed in the Vrischikam month as per traditional Malayalam Calendar. Lord Guruvayur is an incarnation of Lord Vishnu.

question.content: Which country celebrates one of the famous festivals known as Paro Tschechu?

solution.content: Bhutan. Paro Tsechu - A mask dance to celebrate the birth anniversary of Padmasambhava (Guru Rimpoche). It is a five-day festival held every year in the month of March or at the beginning of April.

question.content: Which of the following religious festivals is known as Peerla Panduga in Telangana?

solution.content: Muharram (first month of the Islamic Lunar Calendar). It is a sacred festival that commemorates the martyrdom of Hazrat Imam Hussein and is marked by processions. During this occasion, a relic called Alam is taken out as a procession.

question.content: Makaravilakku festival is celebrated in which of the following Indian states?

solution.content: Kerala. It is celebrated annually in the Sabarimala Temple.

question.content: Which festival celebrated by Muslims is also known as Barawafat? Higher Secondary 28/06/2023 (Shift - 2)

options.text: Shab-e-Barat grandson, Hussein lbn Ali. Id-ul-Zuha Also known as Eid al-Adha or the Feast of Sacrifice. It honours the willingness of Abraham to sacrifice his son, Ismail, as an act of obedience to God's command. Shab-e-Barat is the night on which Allah grants repenting Muslims forgiveness for their sins and answers their duas.

question.content: Which of the following harvest festivals is celebrated in Karnataka in the months of November-December?

solution.content: Huthri The annual rice harvest festival which is celebrated by the communities living in Coorg (Kodagu). Other festivals of Karnataka : Kambala Festival (March and November), Hampi Festival (November), Pattadakal Dance Festival (January), Makar Sankranti (January), Ugadi (April), Vairamudi Festival (March), Karaga Festival (March/april), Vara Mahalakshmi Pooja (August).

question.content: In which of the following states is the Tamu Lachar festival celebrated as the New Year by the Gurung Community?

solution.content: Sikkim. Tamu Lochar marks the beginning of the Gurung New Year which falls on the 15th day of Pusa, according Vikram Sambat and 30th December in the English Calendar.

question.content: Which among the following is an agricultural festival of Arunachal Pradesh and celebrated by the Galo tribe?

solution.content: Mopin. It is a celebration of the harvesting season held in the months of April in East Siang and West Siang districts. Major tribes (Arunachal Pradesh) Adi, Aka, Apatani, Nyishi, Tagins, Bori, and Bokar.

question.content: Which among the following is the famous harvest festival of Meghalaya, India?

solution.content: Milad-un-Nabi - Celebrated to commemorate the birth of the Prophet Muhammad. Other festivals of Muslims: Muharram First month of the Islamic calendar, is also known as the Hijri and the 'Month of Allah'. It commemorates the death of the prophet Muhammed's Sol.592.(d) Nongkrem festival. Period - In the month of November, every year. Venue Smit, the Khasi Hills in Meghalaya. It is celebrated during Autumn at Smit, the cultural centre of the Khasi Hills.

question.content: Navreh is the lunar new year that is celebrated in which of the following states/union territories?

solution.content: Jammu and Kashmir. Navreh - It falls on the first day of the Chaitra Navratri. On this day Kashmiri pandits look at a bowl of rice which is considered as a symbol of riches and fertility.

question.content: _ is a festival of sowing seeds in the field. It is a major festival celebrated in Jharkhand.

solution.content: Rohini. Festivals like Rajsawala Ambavati and Chitgomha are also celebrated with Rohini.

question.content: Which of the following gods/goddess is NOT associated with the Ratha Yatra festival of Puri, Odisha?

solution.content: Lord Shiva. Ratha Yatra (Puri) This festival takes place on the second day of the Shukla Paksha (waxing gibbous phase of the moon) of Ashadha. Three deities and their chariots: Lord Jagannath (Nandighosh), Lord Balabhadra (Taladhwaja) and their sister Subhadra (Darpadalana), travel in three different chariots. Jagannath temple is one of the Char Dham pilgrimage sites in India.

question.content: Raja Parba festival of Odisha is the living cultural heritage and agricultural way of life. It is held for three days in the month of

solution.content: June. Raja Parba - Dedicated to Mother Earth (Bhuma Devi) and womanhood at large. The festival marks the arrival of the monsoon season or solar month of Mithuna. Pahili Raja (the first day of the festival), Mithuna Sankranti (second day), Bhu daha or Basi Raja (Third day).

question.content: Dussehra festival is also known as

solution.content: Vijayadashami (Dashain) - A Hindu festival celebrated at the end of Sharad Navaratri every year. It is observed on the tenth day in the Hindu calendar month of Ashvin (September -October). Ramlila was added to UNESCO's list of Intangible Cultural Heritage in 2008. Dashain is a festival celebrated in Nepal. It symbolizes the victory of good over evil.

question.content: The Yaoshang festival of Manipur is celebrated for days.

solution.content: Five. Yaoshang festival (Manipur's version of Holi) - Celebrated every year on the full moon of Lamta month (February-March) of the Meitei lunar calendar. The highlight of the festival is the 'ThabalChongba' (folk dance). It commemorates the birthday of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu.

question.content: Tusu is a harvest festival celebrated in Jharkhand during the winter on the last day of month.

solution.content: Poush. Tusu is mostly seen in the area between Bundu, Tamar, and Raidih areas of Jharkhand.

question.content: Which among the following festivals is the thanksgiving festival, mainly celebrated in Goa?

solution.content: Ladainha (celebrated by Christians). Other festivals in Goa: Shigmo, Sao Joao, Sunburn, Grape Escapade.

question.content: Which among the following is a ritual of cleaning the earth as well as worshipping the fourteen gods in Tripura, India?

solution.content: Kharchi Puja. Performed in Agartala in July or August, the festival involves the worship of the fourteen gods forming the dynasty deity of the Tripuri people. Banni festival is celebrated in Andhra Pradesh. It involves visiting a temple well equipped with weapons.

question.content: Pongal, the four day Harvest festival is generally celebrated in

solution.content: South India. Pongal (Thai Pongal) is a four-day harvest festival celebrated in South India and Sri Lanka. It is a major festival of the Tamil people, and is also celebrated by other communities in the region. The festival is dedicated to the sun god, Surya, and marks the end of the winter solstice.

question.content: The six-day Khajuraho Dance festival is celebrated in which of the following state?

solution.content: Madhya Pradesh. Khajuraho Dance Festival: Organized by - Kala Parishad of the Madhya Pradesh government. Held at - Khajuraho temples (20th Feb to 26th Feb). Started in - 1975.

question.content: Kicheri is a harvest festival and involves ritual bathing, celebrated majorly in

solution.content: Uttar Pradesh. Makar Sankranti (Harvest festival): Celebrated in different states with different names - Uttarayan in Gujarat, Maghi in Punjab, Magha Saaji in Himachal Pradesh, Pongal in Tamil Nadu. Celebrated in the month of January.

question.content: The Chhath Puja festival is dedicated to the God.

solution.content: Sun. Chhath Puja is celebrated in the Indian states of Bihar, Jharkhand, Uttar Pradesh, and Nepal. It is celebrated over four days in the month of Kartika according to the Hindu lunar Vikram Samvat calendar. The first day is Nahai Khai (day of fasting and bathing). The second day is Kharna (day of feasting). The third day is Sandhya Arghya (day of offering prayers to the setting sun). The fourth day is Usha Arghya (offering prayers to the rising sun).

question.content: The festival of Holika Dahan marks the

solution.content: victory of good over evil. Holi (Festival of colours, Phagwa): Celebrated in Phalgun (last month of the Hindu Calendar). It marks the end of winter and the beginning of spring. Different names in the different regions Rang Panchami (Maharashtra, Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh), Lathmar Holi (Uttar Pradesh), Holla Mohalla (Punjab), Shigmo (Goa), Royal Holi (Udaipur), Kumaoni Holi and Khadi Holi (Uttarakhand), Manjal Kuli (Kerala), Dol Jatra (West Bengal), Yaosang (Manipur), Phaguwa (Bihar).

question.content: Diwali marks the day when lord Ram returned to Ayodhya after _ years of exile after defeating king ravan.

solution.content: 14. Diwali is a festival of lights and represents the victory of good against evil, wisdom over ignorance, light against darkness, and faith over suffering.

question.content: Which activity symbolizes the celebration of Uttarayan festival in Gujarat?

solution.content: Kite Flying. The festival of Uttarayan marks the day when winter begins to turn into summer. It takes place during Makar Sankranti (harvest festival) in the month of January.

question.content: "Solung" is a festival celebrated by the Adi Tribe of which state?

solution.content: Arunachal Pradesh. Solung festival is celebrated in the first week of September as an agricultural festival.

question.content: Which among the following festivals marks the birthday of a great Buddhist saint Je Tsongkhapa?

solution.content: Galdan Namchot is often celebrated in Tibet, Mongolia and Ladakh. This Festival marks the beginning of the New Year in Ladakh.

question.content: Which among the following is the monsoon mud festival of Goa?

solution.content: Chikal Kalo. It is celebrated on the 12th day of the month of Ashadh that roughly falls in July. The Devaki-Krishna temple grounds of Marcel village in Goa are the venue for the celebration of the festival.

question.content: Ganga Dussehra takes place every year on the day of Shukla Paksha of Jyeshtha month.

solution.content: 10th. Ganga Dussehra (Gangavataran) Hindu festival, marks the descendance of river Ganga on Earth. Holi: full moon date (Purnima) of Falgun month (Feb-March).

question.content: Which of the following festivals in Punjab is celebrated to commemorate the formation of the Khalsa Panth?

solution.content: Baisakhi (Sikh New Year) commemorates the formation of Khalsa Panth by Guru Gobind Singh in 1699. It is mainly celebrated in the states of Punjab and Haryana. It is a spring harvest festival usually celebrated on 13 or 14 April every year. Lohri (marks the passing of the winter solstice), Hola Mohalla (three-day long Sikh festival which normally falls in March), Teej (also known as Teeyan, dedicated to the onset of the monsoon).

question.content: Which of the following festivals is known as Vijaya Utsav?

solution.content: Hampi festival (Karnataka), is celebrated for 2 or 3 days and reflects the pomp, splendor and glory of the Vijayanagara Empire.

question.content: Where is the Sair-E-Gul Faroshan festival held?

solution.content: Delhi. Sair-E-Gul Faroshan is a three-day festival, generally held in the month of September, just after the rainy season in the region of Mehrauli.

question.content: Which of the following is celebrated as the New Year in Tamil Nadu?

solution.content: Puthandu (Puthuvarudam, Tamil New Year). Chittirai (14 April) on the Tamil calendar, celebrated as a festival by Tamil Hindus of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry.

question.content: Wangala festival is celebrated by which of the following tribes?

solution.content: Garo tribe. Wangala Festival (100 drums festival) is a harvest festival held in honor of Saljong, the Sun-god of fertility. It also signifies the onset of winter. Bhil tribe Bhagoria Festivals (Madhya Pradesh). Tharu tribe (southern Nepal and northern India) - Dashain (Vijayadashami), Tihar (Deepawali), and Jitiya. Bhutia tribe (Sikkim) Losar festival.

question.content: Kagyed dance, a customary dance festival which is celebrated annually in Sikkim falls in which month?

solution.content: December. Kagyed dance (celebrated by Buddhists in the name of eight tantrik Gods and Goddesses) a customary dance festival, celebrated annually in Sikkim falls on the 28th and 29th day of the tenth month according to the Tibetan calendar and December month according to the English calendar.

question.content: A Hindu festival celebrated by the Tamil community that falls in the Tamil Solar Month is called?

solution.content: Thaipusam (This festival is dedicated to Lord Muruga, celebrated on the full moon in the Tamil month of Thai in January/February).

question.content: The birthday of Prophet Muhammad is also celebrated by the name of

solution.content: Mawlid al-Nabi refers to the observance of the birthday of prophet Muhammad, which is commemorated in Rabi' al-awwal, the third month in the Islamic calendar.

question.content: Which of the following festivals is organised by the Government of Karnataka, usually in January, to celebrate the grandeur of temples at a UNESCO heritage site?

solution.content: Pattadakal Dance Festival is a three-day affair and a celebration of the temples in the small village (Pattadakal) of Karnataka.

question.content: Which Indian religious festival has recently been included in the representative list of intangible cultural heritage of humanity by UNESCO, an organisation of the United Nations?

solution.content: Durga Puja (Durgotsava or Sharadotsav) is a ten-day Hindu festival. It is held in September or October in Kolkata (West Bengal). It was included in the UNESCO List of Intangible Cultural Heritage (2021, List was established in 2008).

question.content: Guru Purnima, a festival celebrated by Hindus, Jains and Buddhists in India falls in which month of Hindu calendar?

solution.content: Ashadha. It is observed on the Full Moon day (Purnima) in the Hindu month of Ashadha (June -July). Guru Purnima (Vyaas Purnima) is celebrated in India, Nepal, and Bhutan by Hindus, Jains, and Buddhists.

question.content: Thiruvathira is a cultural festival of which of the following Indian states?

solution.content: Kerala. The 'Thiruvathira festival is celebrated to commemorate the plea of Goddess Parvathi who used to regularly observe fast on Thiruvathira day in the name of Lord Shiva.

question.content: Which festival is celebrated in the month of February by the Angami tribe of Nagaland?

solution.content: Sekrenyi Festival also known as Sokre-n and Phousanyi. Losoong is a Sikkimese New Year festival. The festival is celebrated by Bhutia and Lepcha tribes in India, Bhutan and Nepal. Majuli (biggest river island in the world) festival celebrated in Assam.

question.content: In which of the following Indian states is Dunnapothula Panduga celebrated?

solution.content: Telangana. Dunnapothula Panduga (Sadar) is a buffalo carnival. Some Famous festivals are Pongal (Tamil Nadu), Ganga Sagar Mela, Durga Puja (West Bengal), Bihu (Assam), Kakatiya festival (Telangana).

question.content: Fugdi, a Goan folk dance performed in the Konkan region, is performed generally during which of the following Hindu religious festivals?

solution.content: Ganesh Chaturthi. Folk Dances of Goa Dhalo, Mando, Dekhni, Dashavatar.

question.content: 'Laru Kaj' is a festival primarily celebrated by the Gonds of Higher Secondary 01/08/2022 (Shift - 3)

solution.content: Madhya Pradesh. Other festivals - Meghnad parv (Gond tribe), Ratona (Baiga tribe), Bhagoriya (bhil tribe), etc.

question.content: The custom of decorating eggs is practiced during which of the following festivals? Higher Secondary 02/08/2022 (Shift - 2)

solution.content: Easter (Latin Pascha) is a principal festival of the Christian church, which celebrates the Resurrection of Jesus Christ on the third day after his Crucifixion. It falls on the first Sunday after the first full moon of spring.

question.content: Sammakka-Sarakka Jatara is celebrated in which of the following states of India? Higher Secondary 04/08/2022 (Shift -3)

solution.content: Telangana. Festivals of Telangana Bathukamma, Bonalu ,Medaram Jatara.

question.content: In which of the following states is the Goncha Festival celebrated?

solution.content: Chhattisgarh. The Goncha Festival is also popularly known as the Chariot Festival probably because it is celebrated at a time when the Hindus celebrate Rath Yatra.

question.content: Mahavir Jayanti is celebrated in the month of

solution.content: April. It is one of the most important religious festivals in Jainism. This day marks the birth of Vardhamana Mahavira, who was the 24th and the last Tirthankara and who succeeded the 23rd Tirthankara, Parshvanatha.

question.content: The Chera Panhara ritual is associated with:

solution.content: Rath Yatra in Odisha. The Gajapati Maharaja perform the Chhera Pahanra, which involves sweeping of the decks of the chariots with a gold-plated broomstick on Rath Yatra.

question.content: The International Sand Art festival is usually held in

solution.content: Odisha. Art Festivals of India: Kala Ghoda Arts Festival (Mumbai). Ellora-Ajanta International Festival (Aurangabad). Surajkund Crafts Mela (Haryana). Taj Mahotsav (Agra). Serendipity Arts Festival (Goa).

question.content: Baishagu festival is associated with the state of in India.

solution.content: Assam. The Baishagu Festival is generally celebrated by the tribe of Boro Kacharis in the month of Baishak, which is mid-April. It is the celebration of the spring season for the arrival of the new year.

question.content: The Festival of Salhesh celebrated in the state of:

solution.content: Bihar. Famous festivals of Bihar - Chhath Puja, Buddha Jayanti, Sonepur Cattle Fair, Rajgir Mahotsav, Sama-Chakeva, Bihula, Madhushravani, Pitrapaksha Mela, and Malmas Mela.

question.content: Kumarakom boat race is the most admired boat race to take place on the Vembanad Lake in September during the _ festival.

solution.content: During Onam festival in September, Kumarakom boat race takes place on the Vembanad Lake in Kerala. This festival is mainly conducted to celebrate the arrival of the famous Sri Narayana Guru at the Kumara Mangalam Temple.

question.content: Which of the following states celebrates the Float Festival?

solution.content: Tamil Nadu. Float Festival is celebrated at the famous Meenakshi Amman Temple which is dedicated to Goddess Meenakshi who is believed to be the reincarnation of Goddess Parvati.

question.content: Gochi festival is an Indian festival majorly celebrated in

solution.content: Himachal Pradesh. Festivals & Fairs of Himachal Pradesh :- Halda Festival, Kullu Dussehra Fair, Ice Skating Carnival, Losar Festival, International Himalayan Festival, Doongri Fair, Sazo Festival, Phulaich Festival, Sair Festival, Nuala Festival, Khepa Festival, Minjar Fair, Renuka Fair, Markand Fair, Rali Puja Festival, Deotsidh Fair.

question.content: 'Maru Mahotsav' also known as desert festival is celebrated in

solution.content: Maru Mahotsav (Jaisalmer desert festival) is held in the Hindu month of Magh (February), three days prior to the full moon. The festival is celebrated amidst the beautiful dunes of the Thar Desert in the Sam dunes.

question.content: In which district of Rajasthan is the Elephant festival celebrated every year?

solution.content: Jaipur. Elephant Festival, a traditional festival of Rajasthan, held every year at Jaipur Polo Ground on the day of Holi.

question.content: The Deccan festival is a five-day long festival which reflects the culture of the Deccan. The festival is associated with which state?

solution.content: Andhra Pradesh.

question.content: Soorya Classical Dance Festival is held in for 10 days every year.

solution.content: Thiruvananthapuram (Kerala), this festival is organized by Soorya Stage and Film Society.

question.content: Elephanta Festival is the cultural pride of_ among the dance and music festivals of India.

solution.content: Maharashtra. Elephanta Festival is celebrated in February every year on Elephanta islands in Mumbai, Maharashtra. The Elephanta Caves founded by King Krishnaraja (Kalachuri dynasty) are a collection of cave temples predominantly dedicated to the Hindu God Shiva.

question.content: Held in the month of the Ellora Ajanta Dance Festival is an interface between the culture and history of India.

solution.content: January. Ellora Festival (Ellora Ajanta Festival) organized by Maharashtra Tourism Development (MTDC) is celebrated every year for three days. The paintings and sculptures of Ajanta and Ellora caves have been UNESCO World Heritage Sites since 1983 and are considered masterpieces of Buddhist religious art.

question.content: Tribes of the Nicobar Islands pay their respects to the departed soul of the head of the family during the

solution.content: Ossuary Feast. Goddess Jagadhatri Puja is worshiped in the West Bengal region. Gajan is a Hindu festival, associated with such deities as Shiva-Parvati. Kalpataru Utsav is an annual religious festival observed by monks of the Ramakrishna Math.

question.content: Which of the following festivals is held on a new moon day?

solution.content: Kali Puja. It is celebrated on the new moon day of the Hindu month Kartik.

question.content: 'Sangken' is a festival of the

solution.content: Buddhists. More Buddhists festivals include Buddha Purnima, Hemis Festival, Losar Festival, Lumbini Festival, Parinirvana Day, Rumtek Chaam Festival and Mani Rimdu Festival. Famous Jains Festivals are Paryushana, Janma kalayanak, Ashtanhika Parv, Nandishwar Ashtanika, Gyana Panchami, Pausha Dashmi.

question.content: In which Indian state is the 'Fatorpa Zatra' celebrated?

solution.content: Goa. It is celebrated at the temple of Shantadurga Kuncolienkarin at Fatorpa in Quepem taluka. Famous Temple Fairs in India: Odisha - Puri Rath Yatra; Kerala Thrissur Pooram, Arattu Festival, Attuvela Mahotsavam; Tamil Nadu Chithirai Thiruvizha Festival; Karnataka- Vairamudi Garuda Utsavam Festival, Karaga Festival; Andhra Pradesh - Kotappakonda Temple Fair; Uttarakhand Nanda Devi Chaturdashi Mela.

question.content: Festival, Vaikunth _ is an annual three-day festival held at Bara Shaheed Dargah in Nellore

solution.content: Rottela Panduga. Baishagu, Ali Ai Ligang, Barpeta, sabha, Bhel Diya Festival, Me-Dum-Me-Phi, Kamrup Bhatheli are famous festivals of Assam.

question.content: The festival of Durga Puja is observed to celebrate the triumph of goddess Durga over_

solution.content: Mahishasura. It is the famous festival of West Bengal, Jharkhand, Orissa. Durga Puja, a major festival of Hinduism, traditionally held for 10 days in the month of Ashvina (September-October).

question.content: The Kodava community of Coorg worships weapons during the _ festival.

solution.content: Kailpodh. It is celebrated in September. Kail means weapon or armor and Pold means festival. Puttari is the harvest festival of Kodava community.

question.content: Which one of the following is a Jain festival celebrated for eight days by the Shwetambar community and ten days as Dasalakshan Parva by the Digambar community?

solution.content: Paryushan festival is a Jain festival celebrated for eight days by the Shwetambar community and ten days as Dasalakshan Parva by the Digambar community.

question.content: Which of the following festivals is also known as the 'Manipuri New Year'?

solution.content: Cheiraoba. List of festivals in Manipur are Gang-Ngai, Lui-Ngai-Ni, Yaosang. Kang: The Ratha Yatra of Manipur, Heikru Hitongba, Ningol Chak-Kouba: A social festival of the Manipuris, Kut: Festival of Kuki Chin- Mizo.

question.content: To which of the following incarnations of Vishnu is Dhanuyatra of Odisha's Bargarh district dedicated?

solution.content: Lord Krishna. Dhanu Jatra or Dhanu Yatra is an annual drama-based open-air theatrical performance celebrated in Bargarh, Odisha.

question.content: Kaveri Sankramana is a festival celebrated October. in _ in the month of

solution.content: Karnataka. Kaveri Sankramana is celebrated at Talakaveri in Kodagu district in Karnataka.

question.content: Which state in India celebrates the 'Sundareswara Festival'?

solution.content: Kerala. The Sri Sundareswara temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva. Every year a festival is celebrated where hundreds of devotees attend the festival.

question.content: Drukpa Tsechi, a festival celebrated in Sikkim, is associated with which of the following personalities?

solution.content: Lord Buddha. This festival celebrates Lord Buddha's first preaching of the Four Noble Truths to his first five disciples at Sarnath.

question.content: In which of the following months is the 'Valvil Ori Vizha' festival of Tamil Nadu celebrated?

solution.content: August. It is celebrated in a grand manner in the Kolli Hills of Tamil Nadu.

question.content: festival in the Bastar region is celebrated along with the worship of the local goddess, Kesharpal Kesharpalin Devi.

options.text: Khatarua Uttarakhand :- Bhitauli, Harela, Phool Dei, Batsavitri, Ganga Dussehra or Dasar, Dikar Puja, Olgia or Ghee Sankranti, Khatarua, Ghuian Ekadashi, Chhipla Jaat, Kandali, Janopunya, Kumaon Holi

question.content: Teeyan is a festival celebrated in Punjab, which celebrates the onset of

solution.content: Monsoon. A cultural festival observed by and for women, Teeyan or Punjabi. Teeyan begins on the third day of Saawan Maas and ends on Saawan Purnima, spanning a total of thirteen days.

question.content: In which festival of Maharashtra and Chhattisgarh, are the bullocks and other cattles used for agriculture worshipped?

solution.content: Pola is a thanksgiving festival celebrated by farmers in Maharashtra, to acknowledge the importance of bulls and oxen, who are a crucial part of agriculture and farming activities. It falls on the day of the Pithori Amavasya (the new moon day) in the month of Shravana (usually in August).

question.content: Which of the following festivals is called the month of merits and is celebrated between May and June?

solution.content: Saga Dawa. It is the most significant and sacred for the followers of Mahayana Buddhism who, on this auspicious occasion, commemorate Lord Buddha's birth, his attainment of enlightenment and salvation from this corporeal world. It is celebrated in Sikkim.

question.content: Arthunkal Feast and Vettukad Festival are church festivals from the state of

solution.content: Kerala. Other Church festivals of Kerala Bharananganam, Edappally Perunal, Edathua, (c) Harela (d) Phool Dei Kadamattom, Kallooppara Perunal, Sol.660.(a) Madai. Festivals of Koratty, Malayattur, Manjinikkara Maramon Convention, Niranam, Rakkuli Thirunal, St. Dominic Syrian, Thumpoly, Vettukad.

question.content: Baliyatra, literally meaning 'voyage to Bali', is a festival celebrated particularly in _ with great fanfare.

solution.content: Cuttack. It is a city in Odisha located on the banks of Mahanadi river. It is Asia's largest open trade fair. This festival is celebrated every year From the date of Kartika Purnima (full moon day on the day of Kartika) according to the Odia calendar.

question.content: Which of the following states will you go to enjoy the famous Gaura-Gauri Puja that is celebrated every year?

solution.content: Chhattisgarh. Gaura-Gauri Puja is celebrated on the day after Diwali. The festival celebrates the pastoral life of the people of Chhattisgarh. The gathering sees the rituals of 'gedi", 'Raut nacha' and 'panthi nritya' in the traditional attire.

question.content: In which of the following festivals the meaning is 'merry making of the gods'?

solution.content: Lai Haraoba is the ritual ceremonial festival of Manipur which is believed to be the act of re-enactment of the creation of the universe by the gods and goddesses at the sacred site Haraothel of Koubru Hill.
